intro: Tetranthera wightii, commonly known as the Indian nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, and it is often found in moist, shady environments. Tetranthera wightii is known for its stinging hairs, which can cause skin irritation upon contact.
